title: Value is a story
excerpt: People do lots of things that (on the surface) make no sense.

children.text: People do lots of things that (on the surface) make no sense.
Buying modern art. Mowing your lawn. Paying extra for the expos√© of opulence.
That's because surface level assumptions rarely encompass the stories people tell themselves about these trade-offs.
Behind every action (even absurd ones) is a value exchange. The
of this transaction. The idea that you can trade things--time, money, attention--for other things that appear to be worth more than they cost.
Status, prestige, the idea that we're in sync--these are only as real as we make them. But by taking part in the value exchange, we can at least tell ourselves that they are.
